intro: Planera ulmifolia, commonly known as the western catalpa, is a deciduous tree native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The tree produces long, cylindrical pods that contain flat, winged seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and ornamental contexts.
